Class Inventory

  • java.lang.Object
    • Inventory
  • public class Inventory
extends java.lang.Object
    Manages a collection of devices in an inventory. Provides functionalities to add, remove, update, and query devices, as well as to calculate inventory statistics and export inventory reports.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Inventory()
      Constructs an Inventory instance and initializes the list of devices.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods

      Adds a device to the inventory.
      void exportInventoryReport​(java.lang.String filename)
      Exports the inventory report to a specified file.
      Device findDeviceByName​(java.lang.String name)
      Finds a device by name.
      java.util.List<Device> getAllDevices()
      Returns a new list containing all devices in the inventory.

      Finds and returns the cheapest device in the inventory.

      Calculates the total value of the inventory.

      Removes a device from the inventory by name.

      Restocks or deducts stock for a device by name.

      Sorts the devices in the inventory by price.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Inventory

        public Inventory()
        Constructs an Inventory instance and initializes the list of devices.

    • Method Detail

      • addDevice

        public void addDevice​(Device device)
        Adds a device to the inventory.

        Time complexity: O(1) on average, but can be O(n) in the worst case when resizing is required.

        Parameters:
        device - The device to add.

      • removeDevice

        public boolean removeDevice​(java.lang.String name)
        Removes a device from the inventory by name.

        Time complexity: O(n), where n is the number of devices, since it may need to scan the entire list.

        Parameters:
        name - The name of the device to remove.
        Returns:
        true if a device was removed; false otherwise.

      • findDeviceByName

        public Device findDeviceByName​(java.lang.String name)
        Finds a device by name.

        Time complexity: O(n), where n is the number of devices, since it may need to scan the entire list.

        Parameters:
        name - The name of the device to find.
        Returns:
        The device if found; null otherwise.

      • updateDevice

        public void updateDevice​(java.lang.String name,
                         double price,
                         int quantity)
        Updates the price and quantity of a device by name. If the device does not exist, no action is taken.

        Time complexity: O(n), because it uses findDeviceByName(String) internally.

        Parameters:
        name - The name of the device to update.
        price - The new price of the device.
        quantity - The new quantity of the device.

      • getAllDevices

        public java.util.List<Device> getAllDevices()
        Returns a new list containing all devices in the inventory.

        Time complexity: O(n), where n is the number of devices.

        Returns:
        A list of all devices.

      • getCheapestDevice

        public Device getCheapestDevice()
        Finds and returns the cheapest device in the inventory.

        Time complexity: O(n), as it scans through all devices.

        Returns:
        The cheapest device, or null if the inventory is empty.

      • getTotalInventoryValue

        public double getTotalInventoryValue()
        Calculates the total value of the inventory.

        Time complexity: O(n), as it needs to aggregate values from all devices.

        Returns:
        The total value of all devices in the inventory.

      • restockDevice

        public boolean restockDevice​(java.lang.String name,
                             int quantity,
                             boolean addStock)
        Restocks or deducts stock for a device by name. If the device is not found, or if the operation results in a negative quantity, the operation fails.

        Time complexity: O(n), due to the search operation.

        Parameters:
        name - The name of the device to restock.
        quantity - The quantity to add or remove.
        addStock - If true, adds stock; otherwise, removes stock.
        Returns:
        true if the operation was successful; false otherwise.

      • sortDevicesByPrice

        public java.util.List<Device> sortDevicesByPrice()
        Sorts the devices in the inventory by price.

        Time complexity: O(n log n), where n is the number of devices, due to sorting.

        Returns:
        The list of devices sorted by price.

      • exportInventoryReport

        public void exportInventoryReport​(java.lang.String filename)
        Exports the inventory report to a specified file. The report includes a list of all devices, their details, and a summary of the total number of devices and the total inventory value. Each device is listed with its category, name, price, and quantity. The report also includes the date it was generated.

        Time complexity: O(n), where n is the number of devices. Writing to a file is generally considered O(1) for each write operation, but since the method iterates over all devices to generate the report, the overall complexity is O(n).

        Parameters:
        filename - The name of the file to which the report will be exported.
